RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 76. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 10 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since April 10 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. 3 Year olds Claiming $6,000 (BC Bred $7500). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.

CLAIM.OWNER: LeMasurier Paul Bulldog Bros Racing and Thacker Robbie

RACE.FOOTNOTES: ANAAMY away alertly and stalked the leader into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, commenced her bid one out from the rail entering the final turn, angled in to avoid getting carried out leaving the turn, and closed determinedly from along the rail in the drive to prevail. NO PEOPLE away well and tracked the pacesetter into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, launched her bid two wide entering the final turn, and finished willingly three wide in the drive to get up for the place. VALERIE VALESKI broke sharply and raced to the lead while racing two wide entering the backside, controlled the pace in the run down the backstretch and through the final turn, was collared entering the lane, and gave way grudgingly late. ROSE OF TEXAS hopped at the start to get away slowly, and trailed the field entering the first turn, began to advance midway down the backstretch, saved ground at the rail entering the final turn, and finished two wide in the drive while unable to make a serious late impact. SKY FACTOR tracked the leader into the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, began to lose touch with the pacesetters in the run to the final turn, and had nothing to offer late.

ENTRY.NAME: Anaamy
ENTRY.OWNER: Goss Maureen Canmor Farms and Trombley Adrian
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, stalked, rallied 2 wide, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: No People
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked 2w, rallied 2w, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Valerie Valeski
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, led 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Rose of Texas
ENTRY.OWNER: Danard Don B and Snow Mel
ENTRY.COMMENT: hopped start, trailed, rallied inside, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Sky Factor
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 3 wide, through early

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 2 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 60. Maiden Claiming Purse 16000. (PLUS UP TO $7,000 THRIF) FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000, For Each $2,500 To $20,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $32,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BAK TO LIBERTY hopped at the start, but easily assumed command in the run to the first turn while racing just out from the rail, controlled the pace in the run down the backstretch and into the final turn, turned back a bid by MAGIC ROAD leaving the final turn, and drew clear in the lane while under confident handling to prove much the best. MAGIC ROAD away alertly and tracked the pacesetter into the first turn while racing one out from the rail, maintained his position in the run down the backstretch, rallied two wide through the final turn to loom a threat, but was no match for the winner late while proving clearly second best. TONTO missed the break to get away slowly and trailed the field into the first turn, advanced three wide through the turn to gain a tracking trip entering the backstretch, struggled to keep tabs on the pacesetter entering the final turn, and weakened over the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Tonto
ENTRY.OWNER: Freedom Farms Ltd Oliver Wayne D & E Racing and More Rewards Syndicate
ENTRY.COMMENT: missed break, tracked 3 wide, weakened 1/4

ENTRY.NAME: Magic Road
ENTRY.OWNER: Danard Don B and Danard Sue
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, tracked 2 w, rallied 2 w, closed 3 w, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Bak to Liberty
ENTRY.OWNER: Tod Mountain Thoroughbreds and Redekop James
ENTRY.COMMENT: hopped start, led 2 wide, rallied inside, drew clear

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 3 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 71. Claiming Purse 14000. (PLUS UP TO $7,000 THRIF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 10 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since April 10 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000, For Each $1,750 To $12,500 2 lbs. BC Bred Claiming $20,000, Three Year Old $24,000 (BC Bred $30,000).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LOVEABOVEANDBEYOND broke sharply and tracked the leader into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, collared the pacesetter while racing two wide entering the final turn, assumed command entering the lane, and was never seriously threatened late. INDYGOGOLD unhurried early while dropping back to trail, rallied smartly from along the rail entering the final turn, eased into the two path entering the lane, and closed willingly to get up for the place in the closing strides. AMANDA away alertly and stalked the leader into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, rallied two wide entering the final turn, and closed four wide in the drive to just miss the place. ALOBRAH rushed up from along the rail to assume command passing the wire the first time, controlled the speed into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, battled from the inside of LOVEABOVEANDBEYOND entering the final turn, was unable to match strides with that rival entering the lane, and faded in the late going. KAY'S KITCHEN away well and stalked the leader into the backstretch, continued three wide from a stalking trip entering the final turn, but weakened over the final furlong while finishing five wide in the drive.

ENTRY.NAME: Alobrah
ENTRY.COMMENT: led rail, late fade

ENTRY.NAME: Indygogold
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied inside, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Amanda
ENTRY.OWNER: Anderson, Dr. Bryan C. and Carol
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, stalked rail, rallied 2 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Loveaboveandbeyond
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, led, held

ENTRY.NAME: Kay's Kitchen
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, stalked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, weakened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 4 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 74. Claiming Purse 12000. (PLUS UP TO $6,000 THRIF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE MAY 25 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 10 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Sinc e April 10 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $6,250, For Each $625 To $5,000 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $8,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BELLAROO away well and tracked the leader into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, rallied smartly from just off the rail entering the final turn, and closed two wide in the drive to prove best. THE KAT'S BACK away alertly and raced to the lead from just off the rail entering the first turn, controlled the pace in the run down the backside and into the final turn, and gave way grudgingly late in a solid effort. ZETAMARIE settled off the early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, rallied smartly from along the inside entering the final turn, tipped three wide for the drive and closed willingly to garner a share. JERSEY LILLIE broke sharply and tracked the leader into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, forced the issue two wide entering the final turn, was unable to keep tabs on her pace rival while drifting four wide entering the lane, and was outfinished late. QUEEN OF LOVE settled at the back of the pace while racing two out from the rail entering the backstretch, rallied three wide entering the final turn, and finished two out from the rail in the drive while unable to make a serious late impact. IMA DAREDEVIL stalked the early pace into the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, rallied three wide from a tracking trip entering the final turn, but faded in the late stages. IRISH LUNA stalked the early pace while racing one out from the rail entering the backstretch, struggled to hold her position midway to the final turn, but lacked the needed closing response when called upon in a dull effort.

ENTRY.NAME: Bellaroo
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked rail, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide

ENTRY.NAME: Zetamarie
ENTRY.OWNER: Johnson, Gary C., Pumpkin Stable and Sharlea Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied inside, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Queen of Love
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: The Kat's Back
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led, rallied inside, gave way grudgingly

ENTRY.NAME: Irish Luna
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2 wide, lacked response

ENTRY.NAME: Jersey Lillie
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Ima Daredevil
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, faded

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Ross McLeod S. HASTINGS RACE 5 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 88. Stakes Purse 50000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS. By subscription of $100 to accompany the nomination by Midnight Saturday, June 3, 2023 with an additional $750 to enter and $1,000 to start. $50,000 guaranteed, of which 55% goes to the winner, 20% to second, 10% to third,5% to fou rth and 4% to fifth, and 2% sixth through eighth, finishers nineth through eleventh will receive their starter fee back. Weight: 122 lbs. Non-winners of $55,000 in 2022-2023 allowed, 3 lbs. Non-winners of $27,500 in 2022-2023 allowed 5 lbs. Non-winners o f $12,000 in 2022-2023 allowed 7 lbs. Preference will be based on lifetime earnings as recorded by Equibase at time of entry. Field limited to 11 starters. (Max. weight allowance to 115lbs.).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LUCKY FORCE broke sharply and tracked the leader into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, battled two wide from the outside of ROCKCLIFFE entering the final turn, assumed command entering the lane, and held off a late charge from LEGACY SQUARE to prevail. LEGACY SQUARE was pushed in at the start and squeezed slightly from between rivals to get away sluggishly, settled off the early pace while racing two out from the rail entering the backside, rallied two wide entering the final turn, and closed with late interest three wide in the drive to get up for the place while gaining ground late. ROCKCLIFFE away alertly and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, battled through the final turn from the inside of LUCKY FORCE, was unable to keep tabs with that rival entering the lane, but battled determinedly through the lane to garner a share. TIME TICKER settled off the early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, rallied two wide entering the final turn, and finished evenly one out from the rail in the drive. ARISTOCRACY away well and tracked the leader into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, steadied while running up on heels in the run down the backside, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, but faded over the final furlong. ACCIDENTAL HERO settled off the early pace while racing four wide in the run down the backside, rallied three wide entering the final turn, but failed to make a late impact when called upon.

ENTRY.NAME: Rockcliffe
ENTRY.OWNER: Tod Mountain Thoroughbreds and Redekop James
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led rail, rallied inside, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Lucky Force
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked 2w, rallied 2w, led, held

ENTRY.NAME: Time Ticker
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied 2 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Aristocracy
ENTRY.OWNER: Christoff, Gordon and Trails End Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked rail, steadied 3/8, rallied rail, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Legacy Square
ENTRY.OWNER: Tod Mountain Thoroughbreds and Redekop James
ENTRY.COMMENT: squeezed start, settled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Accidental Hero
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 4 wide, rallied 3 wide, needed more

RACE.RACE_TEXT: River Rock Casino S. HASTINGS RACE 6 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 76. Stakes Purse 50000. FOR THREE YEAR OLD FILLIES. By subscription of $100 to accompany the nomination by Midnight Saturday, June 3, 2023 with an additional $750 to enter and $1,000 to start. $50,000 guaranteed, of which 55% goes to the winner, 20% to second, 10% to third, 5% t o fourth and 4% to fifth, and 2% to sixth through eighth, finishers nineth through eleventh will receive their starter fee back . Three Year Olds: 122 lbs. Non-winners of $55,000 in 2022-2023 allowed, 3 lbs. Non-winners of $27,500 in 2022-2023 allowed5 lbs. Non-winners of $12,000 in 2022-2023 allowed 7 lbs. Preference will be based on total earnings in 2022-2023 as recorded by Equibase at time of entry. Field limited to 11 starters. (Max. weight allowance to 115lbs.).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: AIR FORCE broke sharply and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace in the run down the backstretch and into the final turn, held a narrow advantage into the lane, and held off a late surge from ABOVE AVERAGE to prevail. ABOVE AVERAGE tracked the dueling leaders in the run down the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, rallied smartly from along the inside entering the final turn, tipped three wide to split rivals entering the lane, and closed determinedly to just miss. KEY TO SUCCESS tracked the dueling leaders into the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, advanced three wide midway down the backside and collared the leaders entering the final turn, and battled willingly four wide in the drive to garner a share. FORCE TO REKN WITH away well and stalked the early pace while racing one out from the rail entering the backstretch, rallied from along the inside entering the final turn, and finished with late interest from just off the rail in the drive. NEIGHNEIGH away alertly and pressed the pace from the outside of AIR FORCE entering the first turn, continued to force the issue from the outside of that rival in the run down the backstretch and into the final turn, was unable to keep pace with that rival midway through the turn, and weakened in the late stages. FREESTYLE settled at the back of the pack while racing one out from the rail entering the backstretch, advanced three wide in the run to the final turn while racing into a stalking position, rallied two out from the rail entering the final turn, but failed to mount a serious late bid when called upon.

ENTRY.NAME: Air Force
ENTRY.OWNER: Dale Dennis Peter Morris and Welsh Ed
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, led rail, rallied inside, closed 2 wide, held

ENTRY.NAME: Freestyle
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Above Average
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked inside, rallied rail, closed 3 wide, just missed

ENTRY.NAME: Force to Rekn With
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, stalked 2 wide, rallied rail, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Neighneigh
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, pressed 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Key to Success
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 3 wide, advanced 3/8, rallied 3 wide, closed 4 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 7 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 52. Maiden Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: STAR FINALITY stalked the leaders into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, pulled her way into a tracking trip behind the dueling leaders approaching the final turn, bided her time through the final turn while awaiting racing run, slipped through along the rail in mid stretch to take command and draw clear late. DRILL BABY DRILL settled off the early pace while racing mid pack entering the backstretch, rallied three wide through the final turn, and closed willingly four wide in the drive to get up for the place in the closing strides. SHE'S ON FIRE away well and pressed the pace from the outside of LILSISTERLEE entering the backstretch, continued to force the pace two wide entering the final turn, and finished willingly three wide in the drive to garner a share. LILSISTERLEE away alertly and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace from along the rail in the run down the backside and through the final turn, was overtaken in mid stretch, and was outfinished late. STRIKING VALUE settled off the contested early pace while saving ground entering the backstretch, commenced her bid from along the inside entering the final turn, shifted five wide midway through the turn, and finished evenly five wide in the drive. HARBOUR STORM lagged well off the early pace while racing one out from the rail entering the backstretch, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but lacked the needed closing response when called upon. OKANAGAN GOLD was squeezed soon after the start, and took back to last, was always well back and failed to make an impact. BETTER WITH TIME broke sharply and stalked the early pace while racing three wide entering the backstretch, rallied three wide entering the final turn, but weakened over the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Harbour Storm
ENTRY.OWNER: Wilson Warren Stajkowski Neil Sutherland June Switzer G Ross and Hickman Barry
ENTRY.COMMENT: lagged 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Okanagan Gold
ENTRY.COMMENT: squeezed start, trailed, rallied inside, no factor

ENTRY.NAME: Star Finality
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked rail, rallied inside, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Lilsisterlee
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led rail, rallied inside, outfinished late

ENTRY.NAME: Striking Value
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled inside, rallied inside, closed 5 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Better With Time
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, stalked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Drill Baby Drill
ENTRY.OWNER: Danard Don B and Snow Mel
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled inside, rallied 3 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: She's On Fire
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, pressed 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide,
